intro: Xystidium, commonly known as the "spiny shield fern," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spiny, shield-like structures on its stems, which provide protection against herbivores. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, clustered flowers. Xystidium species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and Asia. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky outcrops.
